candidates.title: Has Bill Murray Died at 81, Wanting to See 'Americans United Under Trump'?
candidates.content:
Claim:
Actor-comedian Bill Murray died at age 81 in February 2019, expressing a wish to see Americans united under Trump.
On 9 February 2019, the Conservative Tears website published an article reporting that actor-comedian Bill Murray had died at the age of 81, expressing that he "wanted to see America unite under President Trump":
Bill Murray Dead at 81  Wanted To See Americans United Under Trump
William Billington Bill Murray is dead this evening in his home in Winnetka, Wisconsin. Murray, who left public life a few years ago to pursue a more conservative lifestyle, found out he was dying about three months ago but decided not to make a big deal out of it.
According to his spokesman and lawyer, Art Tubolls, Murray left very simple instructions for his passing:
Bill wanted to see America unite under President Trump and come together to fight against all the things hes fought against his entire career. When he wrote the movie Ghostbusters he used Slimer as an example of how feeding something causes dependence. Stripes was to teach the average American that anyone can be a hero if the timing is right.
None of this was true: at the time this report was published, Bill Murray was still very much alive and only 68 years old. The report of his death was another fabrication by Conservative Tears, a site which is part of the America's Last Line of Defense network of websites and Facebook pages that pump out a steady stream of inflammatory and politically divisive misinformation under the guise of proffering "satire."
candidates.description: Another lame celebrity death hoax from the lamest of junk news sites.

result.explanation: The news caption is false.  Snopes.com debunks the claim that Bill Murray died at age 81 in February 2019 and expressed a desire to see "Americans united under Trump."  Snopes identifies the claim as originating from the Conservative Tears website, a source known for spreading misinformation.
result.supporting_points: Source 1 from Snopes.com explicitly states that the report of Bill Murray's death and his purported statement about President Trump were false.  The source attributes the false report to the Conservative Tears website, which is known for publishing inflammatory and misleading information.

final_result.explanation: The internal check shows high confidence (score 10) that the caption is consistent with the image, as it correctly identifies Bill Murray and indicates his death, aligning with the memorial nature of the image. However, the external check reveals a significant discrepancy.  It shows high confidence (score 10) that the caption's claim of Bill Murray's death in 2019 and his statement about President Trump is false, citing Snopes as a reliable source. The external check directly contradicts the caption's assertion. This conflict necessitates a re-evaluation.  The image itself only displays a memorial, which doesn't definitively confirm or deny the specific circumstances of his death or any statement he made.  The high confidence score of the external check, based on a reputable fact-checking website, significantly outweighs the internal check's confidence.  The internal check only verifies the presence of Bill Murray in a memorial setting, which is insufficient to validate the caption's specific claims about his death and political views. Therefore, the caption is considered out of context because the central claims regarding the date of death and political statement are proven false by the external validation.
final_result.validation_summary: Internal check shows high confidence in entity alignment, but the external check strongly refutes the caption's factual claims, resulting in a final verdict of 'out of context'.
